thread.title: Super Bowl 2017: $1M wager placed on underdog Falcons
thread.title_full: Super Bowl 2017: $1M wager placed on underdog Falcons

author: WSBTV.com 10:24 a.m. Sunday, Feb. 5, 2017 Atlanta Falcons 0 Falcons HOUSTON Big bets on the Super Bowl are not unusual, with every element of the game and halftime show open to a wager, but one bet on the Atlanta Falcons is raising eyebrows. A customer risked $1.1 million to win $1 million on the Falcons covering 3 points, according to an ABC report. >>Complete Super Bowl LI content AJC Super Bowl coverage | WSBTV.com Super Bowl coverage | Fox25Boston.com Super Bowl coverage | Statesman Super Bowl coverage The New England Patriots remain 3-point favorites to win Super Bowl LI and are generating the most money when it comes to wagers, according to sports betting analysts. The betting action includes the pre-game coin flip. According to the ABC report, as of Saturday morning, more money was being bet on heads than tails. >>Former President George H.W. title: Super Bowl 2017: $1M wager placed on underdog Falcons
text:
HOUSTON Big bets on the Super Bowl are not unusual, with every element of the game and halftime show open to a wager, but one bet on the Atlanta Falcons is raising eyebrows.
A customer risked $1.1 million to win $1 million on the Falcons covering 3 points, according to an ABC report.
>>Complete Super Bowl LI content
AJC Super Bowl coverage | WSBTV.com Super Bowl coverage | Fox25Boston.com Super Bowl coverage | Statesman Super Bowl coverage
The New England Patriots remain 3-point favorites to win Super Bowl LI and are generating the most money when it comes to wagers, according to sports betting analysts.
The betting action includes the pre-game coin flip. According to the ABC report, as of Saturday morning, more money was being bet on heads than tails.
>>Former President George H.W. Bush, Barbara Bush to perform Super Bowl LI coin toss
